One, in particular, caught his eyes, a long slender thing,

a thousand guineas it would have cost, he thought.

text: One of the following terms applies to the discussion of both tragedy and comedy
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
Villain reflects an opposing character in literature (antagonist).
There is an explanation video available below.

text: A character that is always against the interest of the protagonist is
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
Rhythm in poetry is marked by poetic metre.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: The idea of metre as used in a literary piece is
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
A tragic hero is one whose weakness contributes to his downfall.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: A hero whose weakness contributes to his downfall is called?
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
It is more or less a literary work about a journey.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: A travelogue is

options.text: a record of the writer's experience during a journey
the account of the experiences of an individual during his lifeline
the account of the travails of a character in a novel
a variant of a novel written in a free style on a writer's journey

subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
A satire ridicles people or ideas; points out their wrong in order for them to change for the better.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: A Literary work that ridicules the shortcomings of people or ideas is ......
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
A copyright prevents other people from producing an intellectual work without the permission of the author.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: The exclusive right given to authors to protect their works from unlawful production is
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
Empathy occurs when the audience shares in the stage experience. The audience in the theatre follows performance and simultaneously understands the feelings of the dramatis personae.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: Empathy is achieved when the audience

options.text: vicariously participates in the stage experience

subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
The mock-epic genre of poetry is one that uses the elevated and serious style of the epic to discuss trivial and unserious issues.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: Mock-heroic poetry elevates

options.text: the important tales of heroes of the past era
trivial subject-matter by using the style of the classical epic
the stripping off of appearances in a witty manner
the beauty in human relationships as exemplified in Homer

subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
The reason is that a dynamic character changes with the event and action.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: ...... is also called a dynamic character
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
This is the major message in a literary work.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: The subject matter of a literary work is the
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

Explanation

text: A dramatic type directed against an individual or a private institute with the intent to severely ridicule is called
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
Anaphora is the repitition of a word or phrase at the beginning of each successive lines of poetry.
There is an explanation video available below.

text:
A time to sow,
A time to reap,
A time to born,
A time to die
This exemplies the use of ...
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
The use of 'like' to compare two things of different class, but of the same attribute.
There is an explanation video available below.

text:
'I am jealous and passonate
Like Jehovah, God of the Jews.'
J.P Clark: Olokun
A device used in the second line of the excerpt above is
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
List of characters.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: Dramatis personae in a play refers to
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
Peripeteia is the reversal of fortune suffered by a tragic hero. It is believed that when a tragic character makes a mistake, such mistake must be punished. Therefore, the consequences of such becomes irredeemable.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: An irredeemable reversal of the hero's fortune in a tragedy is called.
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
The reason is that there is the placement of two contradicting words placed side by side.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: I hate brave cowards like you is an example of
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
A subjective narrator is also involved in the story as the narrator of the story. Such a story is told in the first person narrative technique.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: The narrator in a prose work who is also a character is
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
No official explanation is available for this question at this time. Please check contributions posted by others below. If you can provide an explanation to help other student learn, please click here
There is an explanation video available below.

text: Rays of sun peeping through the cloud , the line is an example of
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
Every line is a metaphor – an imaginative way of describing something by referring to something else which is the same in a particular way.
There is an explanation video available below.

text:
'To see a world in a grain of sand
And a heaven in a wild flower
Hold infinity in the palm of your hand
And eternity in an hour'
- William Blake
To see a World In a Grain of Sand.
The predominant figure of speech used in the lines above is
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
The reason is that the same phrases are repeated at the beginning of each line.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: I had not taken the first step in knowledge, I had not learnt to let go with the hands.The above lines is an example of a
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
 song with French lyrics, occurring from the Middle Ages 
There is an explanation video available below.

text: Chanson is a term denoting a
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
Rhyme scheme is the best answer. The semblance of sound and patternised movement or flow of the words in the excerpt above makes rhyme scheme the predominant literary figure there.

There is an explanation video available below.

text:
'The fair breeze blew
The white foam flew
The furrow followed free
We were the first that ever burst into that silent sea.'

The dominant figure of speech in the above passage is
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
Poetry is the oldest form of literature.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: Which of these is the oldest genre of literature?
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
Flash back. It brings events from the past to the moment.
There is an explanation video available below.

text: A device used by a writer to recall past event in a literary work is
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH

explanation.text:
Explanation
More or less mourning the 'hunter' and 'the blacksmith'. Elegy is a poem written to mourn the dead.
There is an explanation video available below.

text:
The hunter dies
and leaves his poverty to his gun
The blacksmith dies
and leaves his poverty to his anvil...
The extract above is an example of
subject: LITERATURE IN ENGLISH
